summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York discussing media reports about airport workers on St. Thomas who claim to have seen Jeffrey Epstein traveling with what they believed were underage girls. The email suggests interviewing these anonymous sources to gather information relevant to the current case and a potential search warrant.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the investigation; airport workers claim to have seen him flying into St. Thomas with girls they believed were minors.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, requesting follow-up on media reports about Epstein's travel to St. Thomas with potential minors, linking it to the current case and a potential search warrant.

events.title: Media Reports on St. Thomas Airstrip Sightings
events.description: Two recent articles quote multiple workers at the St. Thomas airstrip saying they repeatedly saw Jeffrey Epstein fly in with girls they believed were minors.

keyFacts: Multiple workers at the St. Thomas airstrip have been quoted in articles stating they repeatedly saw Jeffrey Epstein arrive by air with girls they believed were minors.
An Assistant U.S. Attorney is seeking to identify and interview these anonymous airport employees to gather additional information.
This information is considered relevant to the ongoing case against Epstein and in connection with a potential search warrant at the location.
The email indicates that personnel within the prosecutor's unit have previously been inquiring about a potential search warrant for the St. Thomas location.
